docs.lead_paragraph: When a doctor, on hearing of what had been done by the Board of Health with a sick baby, is indignant enough to say to another doctor, "They might just as well throw it into the river," he would seem to reveal, even on the most charitable interpretation of the facts, the existence of something desperately wrong with the system on which our official protectors do their work.
